intro: Ulospermum dichotomum, commonly known as the dichotomous ulospermum, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its leaves are alternate and often have a rough, hairy texture. The flowers are small and yellow, arranged in clusters, making it a distinctive addition to its native habitat.
